name: lambency
content:
lambency noun [U]
(LIGHT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a gentle shining light: He describes the copper bartop as humming with warm lambency. Looking into the lambency of his hooded eyes, I could detect no whiting-out, no glaucoma or cataract.
More examplesFewer examplesOut of this lambency, the Meri rose, radiant, beautiful, all of grace and Light.

lambency noun [U]
(HUMOUR)
the quality of being interesting, clever and humorous, without being unkind: He loved the poet's combination of ferocity and lambency. A longtime Californian, he knowingly evokes the lambency of local yuppie culture.
More examplesFewer examplesThe music has none of Rimsky-Korsakoff's soft felicity and lambency and light sensuousness.
